format:\n&#96;&#96;&#96;\n{CollectionName.modes.ModeName.Group.Subgroup.Variable}\n&#96;&#96;&#96;\n\nExample chain:\n&#96;&#96;&#96;\nGreenshift.Light.Preset.Color.brand\n  â†’ TokenResponse {\n  collection: string;\n  mode?: string;\n  tokens: Token[];\n  metadata: {\n    count: number;\n    types: string[];\n    lastUpdated: string;\n  };\n}\n\ninterface Token {\n  path: string;           // \"Color.Emerald.400\"\n  name: string;           // \"Emerald 400\"\n  value: string | number; // \"#34d399\" or 24\n  type: string;           // \"color\" | \"number\"\n  cssVariable: string;    // \"--primitives-color-emerald-400\"\n  reference?: string;     // \"{Primitives.modes.Default.Color.Emerald.400}\"\n  wpVariable?: string;    // \"--wp--preset--color--brand\"\n}\n&#96;&#96;&#96;\n\n### CSS Variable Naming Convention\n- Primitives: &#96;--primitives-{group}-{name}-{shade}&#96;\n- Semantic: &#96;--semantic-{category}-{role}&#96;\n- Components: &#96;--component-{component}-{property}&#96;\n- Greenshift: &#96;--wp--{preset|custom|style}--{path}&#96;\n\n---\n\n## ğŸ“ Session Notes\n\n###      {item.lh}\n              &lt;/span&gt;\n            &lt;/div&gt;\n          ))}\n        &lt;/div&gt;\n      ),\n    },\n  ];\n\n  return (\n    &lt;div style={{ maxWidth: 'var(--layout-6xl)' _**User (2025-12-07 18:42-0500)**_

style the token mapping callouts the same across pages. Dont mix style and naming conventions because it will confuse new system users. Use either vars or dot notation, not both. It would also make more sense to have the flow documented with the Raw value first, then primitive, semantic, component, etc left to right. I prefer the chip style with the icon and border like the architecture box more than the chips in the chain box.



Remove the visual view from the spacing page. The table view looks better. Also the copy paste buttons and icon styling arent consistent across the app. The colors page particulary looks bad as both copy buttons are inside the color swatch.
